section: The Purpose of the Venture will be determined by the Managers.
explanation: The purpose of a joint venture is a fundamental term. By stating that the Managers determine the purpose, it contradicts the general principle that the Members (owners) define the overall goals and objectives of the venture. It creates a structural flaw because it gives the managers power that is outside of their authority and should belong to the Venture.

section: Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc To be determined USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The inconsistency arises in the capital contribution descriptions. For BorrowMoney.com, inc., the agreed value is 'To be determined USD', implying an undetermined amount. However, JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go, the agreed value is $3,500,000.00 USD. This discrepancy regarding the BorrowMoney's contributions creates an inconsistency as to what the total amount of capital being put into the Venture is.

section: In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined in a manner deemed appropriate by the remaining members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be determined at the discretion of the remaining members.
explanation: This clause introduces an inconsistency because it gives the remaining members full discretion in determining the value of a withdrawing member's interest. This lacks an objective standard for valuation, which could lead to unfair undervaluation and potential disputes. If the remaining members decide that the withdrawing member is not owed anything, or a number far less than what their Capital Contribution was, then this is a conflict.
